oracle.spatial.hadoop.vector.data

Interface AbstractInputDataSet

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ConfigurationStorable, IODataSet
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DistributedDataSet, FileInputDataSet, InputDataSet, MultiInputDataSet, NoSQLInputDataSet, SimpleInputDataSet, SpatialIndexInputDataSet

    public interface AbstractInputDataSet
extends ConfigurationStorable, IODataSet
    Base interface to represent an input data set. An input data set is a data set passed to a job as the input data source.
    Author:
    hsaucedo

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Class<?> getInputFormatClass()
      Gets the InputFormat class used to read the input data set
      long getLength()
      Gets the length (in bytes) of the data set
      java.lang.Class<? extends RecordInfoProvider<?,?>> getRecordInfoProviderClass()
      Gets the RecordInfoProvider class used to extract required information from the key-value pairs provided by the InputFormat.
      SpatialConfig getSpatialConfig()
      Gets the spatial configuration of the data set which defines the spatial features of the data set such as SRID, dimensions and boundaries.
      void setInputFormatClass(java.lang.Class<?> inputFormatClass)
      Sets the InputFormat class used to read the input data set
      void setLength(long length)
      Sets the length (in bytes) of the data set
      void setRecordInfoProviderClass(java.lang.Class<? extends RecordInfoProvider<?,?>> ripClass)
      Sets the RecordInfoProvider class used to extract required information from the key-value pairs provided by the InputFormat.
      void setSpatialConfig(SpatialConfig spatialConfig)
      Sets the spatial configuration of the data set which defines the spatial features of the data set such as SRID, dimensions and boundaries.

        load, store

    • Method Detail

      • getInputFormatClass

        java.lang.Class<?> getInputFormatClass()
        Gets the InputFormat class used to read the input data set
        Returns:
        a subclass of either, org.apache.hadoop.mapred.InputFormat or org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.InputFormat.

      • getLength

        long getLength()
        Gets the length (in bytes) of the data set
        Returns:
        the data set length

      • getRecordInfoProviderClass

        java.lang.Class<? extends RecordInfoProvider<?,?>> getRecordInfoProviderClass()
        Gets the RecordInfoProvider class used to extract required information from the key-value pairs provided by the InputFormat.
        Returns:
        a subclass of RecordInfoProvider

      • getSpatialConfig

        SpatialConfig getSpatialConfig()
        Gets the spatial configuration of the data set which defines the spatial features of the data set such as SRID, dimensions and boundaries.
        Returns:
        a SpatialConfig instance

      • setInputFormatClass

        void setInputFormatClass(java.lang.Class<?> inputFormatClass)
        Sets the InputFormat class used to read the input data set
        Parameters:
        inputFormatClass - a subclass of either, org.apache.hadoop.mapred.InputFormat or org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.InputFormat.

      • setLength

        void setLength(long length)
        Sets the length (in bytes) of the data set
        Parameters:
        length - the data set length

      • setRecordInfoProviderClass

        void setRecordInfoProviderClass(java.lang.Class<? extends RecordInfoProvider<?,?>> ripClass)
        Sets the RecordInfoProvider class used to extract required information from the key-value pairs provided by the InputFormat.
        Parameters:
        ripClass - a subclass of RecordInfoProvider

      • setSpatialConfig

        void setSpatialConfig(SpatialConfig spatialConfig)
        Sets the spatial configuration of the data set which defines the spatial features of the data set such as SRID, dimensions and boundaries.
        Parameters:
        spatialConfig - a SpatialConfig instance.
